intro: Globba nawawii, commonly known as the Hawaiian globba, is a perennial herb native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features erect, leafy stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically displaying shades of white and green. Globba nawawii is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane rainforests.
